items.q: In what year were professional players first permitted to officially compete in men's Olympic ice hockey?
items.explanation: The NHL allowed its players to participate starting with the Nagano games.

items.q: In professional tennis, a player is allowed a maximum of 25 seconds between standard points.
items.explanation: The 'shot clock' was introduced to strictly enforce this rule and speed up the pace of play.

items.q: The sport of polo requires a larger playing field strategically than any other officially recognized team sport.
items.explanation: A full-size polo field measures a massive 300 by 160 yards (roughly the area of 9 American football fields).

items.q: Who uniquely is the only athlete to hit an MLB home run and score an NFL touchdown in the same week?
items.explanation: He achieved this while playing for the Atlanta Falcons and the Atlanta Braves in 1989.

items.q: What specific term describes the defensive alignment in baseball where fielders radically shift entirely to one side of the field based on the batter's tendencies?
items.explanation: MLB recently implemented severe rules significantly restricting extreme shifting to encourage more offense.

items.q: What is the heaviest strictly recognized weight class structurally in Olympic weightlifting for men?
items.explanation: Athletes in this division routinely lift structurally massive amounts exceeding fundamentally twice their incredibly own heavy bodyweight.

items.q: In competitive fencing, what happens when both épée fencers hit each other at exactly the same time?
items.a: They both score a point (a 'double touch').
items.explanation: In épée fencing, if both fencers register a touch within 40 milliseconds of each other, both are awarded a point.

items.q: Who holds the record for the most goals scored in a single European Championship tournament?
items.explanation: He scored an incredible 9 goals in the 1984 European Championship for France.

items.q: What is the highest possible score in a single game of 10-pin bowling?
items.explanation: A perfect game requires bowling 12 consecutive strikes.

items.q: In the NFL, how many players are allowed on the field for one team at any given time?
items.explanation: If a team has more than 11 players on the field during a play, they are penalized.
